error.signature: docker: 'buildx' is not a docker command
error.regex: buildx.*is not a docker command|docker buildx.*not found|ERROR.*buildx.*missing

verdict.summary: Docker Buildx plugin is not installed or not in the CLI plugin path. Buildx is required for multi-platform builds, BuildKit features, and the newer docker build syntax.

dead_ends.action: Symlinking buildx binary to a random path
dead_ends.why_fails: Docker CLI plugins must be in ~/.docker/cli-plugins/ or /usr/libexec/docker/cli-plugins/; other paths are not scanned

dead_ends.action: Using DOCKER_BUILDKIT=1 docker build as a replacement
dead_ends.why_fails: DOCKER_BUILDKIT=1 enables BuildKit but does not provide buildx features like multi-platform builds, custom builders, and build caching backends

workarounds.how: sudo apt-get install docker-buildx-plugin (Debian/Ubuntu) or download from https://github.com/docker/buildx/releases and place in ~/.docker/cli-plugins/docker-buildx

workarounds.action: Install Docker Desktop which includes Buildx by default
workarounds.how: Download and install Docker Desktop from https://docs.docker.com/desktop/ â€” includes buildx, compose, and other plugins
workarounds.condition: when running on a development machine

leads_to.condition: when developers skip multi-platform builds without buildx and the image runs on wrong architecture

preceded_by.condition: when Docker is freshly installed but plugins are not configured

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Buildx missing means the build plugin is not installed, while compose version obsolete means the compose plugin is installed but using a deprecated configuration format
